["Guangyun" picks old cuts, Shanghao, Qing. ]
Also known as "è‰¸1". The modern word for "å±®2".
(1) The general term for herbaceous plants.
(2) In ancient times, it was also called wood.
(3) It refers to hay used as fuel and feed.
(4) Overgrown weeds; grassland; wilderness.
(5) By extension, it refers to the private sector.
(6) Mowing and weeding.
(7) Creation; creation.
(8) Crude; sloppy; concise.
(9) Writing; drafting.
(10) Draft; original copy.
(11) The name of the collection of poems and essays is still unfinished. Such as: Qing Huang Zunxian has "Human Realm Lu Poems".
(12) Cursive script.
(13) Refers to the handwritten form of Pinyin letters.
(14) It is said that the text is scribbled and not neat.
(15) Female. Refers to livestock or poultry. See "Grass Horse", "Grass Donkey", "Grass Chicken".

["Ji Yun" cut early, Shang Hao, from. ]
The ancient character of "Soap 1". The ancient character of "Soap 1".
Later it was written as "Soap (Soap)". The abbreviation for grass bucket, namely Quercus. The shell is boiled in juice and can be dyed black.
